title: Everyday practice strategies for improving online mathematics course design quality

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced mathematics knowledge at the graduate level and online learning experience
context.additional_context: A learning environment where working professionals engage in flexible mobile learning and receive continuous feedback through formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically perform routine improvement activities (revisions, updates, fine-tuning) when designing online math courses.
Learners can explain how everyday interactions in peer collaboration affect quality management through ethnographic case analysis.
Learners can apply real-world examples to demonstrate how iterative improvement processes concretize the concept of "quality" in education.

resources: Mobile Learning Management System (LMS) Access Permissions

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
